title: Crown Princess’s son arrested for alleged assault before rape trial in Norway
byline: The son of Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit has been arrested by police on suspicion of assault, before he goes on trial in Oslo on Tuesday on 38 charges, including the rape of four women.

title: CEB restructuring enters final stage, liquidation to be announced by February
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) restructuring programme has reached its final stage.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Several spells of shower will occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya and Matale districts, today (03), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: SpaceX acquires xAI in record-setting deal as Musk looks to unify AI and space ambitions
byline: Elon Musk said on Monday that SpaceX has acquired his artificial-intelligence startup xAI in a record-setting deal that unifies Musk’s AI and space ambitions by combining the rocket-and-satellite company with the maker of the Grok chatbot.

title: Constitutional Council to decide on AG appointment today
byline: The Constitutional Council is scheduled to meet today (03) at 12.00 noon at the Parliament Complex, under the patronage of its Chairman, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Ex-minister Keheliya Rambukwella’s cousin arrested in money laundering probe
byline: Bandara Rambukwella, a cousin of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, has been arrested on allegations of money laundering by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Bill and Hillary Clinton agree to testify in House Epstein probe ahead of contempt vote
byline: Former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton have agreed to testify in a House investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa summoned to FCID today; CID summons Namal
byline: Shiranthi Rajapaksa, the wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has been summoned to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today (03).

title: Beijing criticises Dalai Lama Grammy win as ‘manipulation’
byline: China has reacted angrily to an unlikely winner at the Grammys - the Dalai Lama - saying it opposes art awards being used for “anti-China political manipulation”.

title: Horana-Colombo private bus strike enters second day
byline: The strike launched by luxury and general service bus operators along the Horana-Colombo (120) route, which began yesterday (02) is continuing for the second consecutive day today (03).

title: Sri Lankans in India invited to join Independence Day flag hoisting ceremony in New Delhi
byline: The High Commission of Sri Lanka in India has invited Sri Lankan nationals residing in India to join the Flag Hoisting Ceremony commemorating the 78th Anniversary of Sri Lanka’s Independence.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa arrives at FCID
byline: Shiranthi Rajapaksa, the wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID), a short while ago.

title: Govt committed to economic stability, sustainable growth and social protection – PM
byline: The Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, reaffirmed the Government’s commitment to economic stability, sustainable growth, and social protection while participating in the South Asia Regional Conference of the World Federation of Consuls (FICAC) 2026.

title: Gold prices increase by Rs. 12,000 in Sri Lanka
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have increased by around Rs. 12,000, in line with a rise in the global market rates.

title: CEB recovers over Rs. 90 mln in losses from illegal electricity connections in 2025
byline: The Special Investigations Unit of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has successfully recovered over Rs. 90 million in losses from parties involved in illegal electricity consumption during the year 2025.

title: India’s Supreme Court slams WhatsApp, Meta over privacy policy
byline: The Supreme Court on Tuesday came down heavily on Meta Platforms Inc and WhatsApp while hearing their appeals against a Competition Commission of India order imposing a penalty of about INR 2131.4 million over the privacy policy, saying tech giants cannot “play with the right to privacy of citizens in the name of data sharing”.

title: School dev. officers on hunger strike meet President for talks
byline: A group of School Development Officers, currently engaged in a fast unto death protest campaign near the Presidential Secretariat, has met with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (03) to seek a definitive solution to their grievances.

title: MP Namal Rajapaksa arrives at CID
byline: SLPP National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago following a summons to provide a statement regarding alleged connections with underworld kingpin “Kehelbaddara Padme”.

title: ‘Michael’ Trailer: Michael Jackson biopic chronicles rise from child star to King of Pop
byline: Lionsgate has released a new trailer for “Michael,” its highly anticipated biopic tracing Michael Jackson’s journey from his early days with the Jackson 5 to his ascent as a global superstar.

title: Appeals Court dismisses petitions challenging remand of Kassapa Thero and another
byline: The Court of Appeal has dismissed petitions seeking to quash the order issued by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court to place in remand custody Venerable Balangoda Kassapa Thero and Venerable Trincomalee Kalyanawansa Tissa Thero in connection with the Trincomalee Buddha statue incident.

title: Lasith Malinga appointed Sri Lanka consultant coach for T20 World Cup
byline: Sri Lanka’s legendary fast bowler Lasith Malinga is set to serve as the Fast Bowling Consultant Coach for the Sri Lankan national team during their four preliminary round matches of the T20 World Cup 2026.

title: School dev. officers end hunger strike after meeting President
byline: A group of School Development Officers, who were engaged in a fast-unto-death protest near the Presidential Secretariat, ended their protest campaign following the meeting with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Rajeev Amarasuriya re-elected uncontested as BASL President
byline: Attorney-at-Law Rajeev Amarasuriya has been re-elected, uncontested, for a further term as President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) for 2026/2027.

title: Spain to ban social media access for children under 16
byline: Spain will ban access to social media for minors under 16 and platforms will be required to implement age verification systems, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Tuesday as he announced several measures to guarantee a safe digital environment.

title: Person arrested with 57kg of turtle meat and 450 turtle eggs
byline: Sri Lanka Coast Guard personnel arrested a suspect in possession of more than 57 kilograms of turtle meat, 450 turtle eggs along with a dinghy boat during a special search operation carried out in the Katuneriya beach area yesterday (02).

title: MP Namal Rajapaksa leaves CID after recording statement
byline: SLPP National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement for over four hours.

title: Writ order annuls summons on ex-President Maithripala over Easter attacks plaint
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued a writ order annulling the decision of the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court to issue summons directing former President Maithripala Sirisena to appear before the court in relation to a private complaint filed regarding criminal negligence for failing to prevent the Easter Sunday terrorist attacks.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa leaves FCID after recording statement
byline: Former First Lady Shiranthi Rajapaksa, wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has left the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) a short while ago after recording a statement for over four hours.

title: Constitutional Council unanimously approves new Auditor General
byline: The Constitutional Council (CC) today unanimously approved the appointment of Senior Deputy Auditor General L.S.I. Jayaratne to the position of Auditor General of Sri Lanka.

title: Grade 6 education reforms to be implemented in 2027 - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that none of the modules introduced for Grade 6 under the new education reforms have been withdrawn.

title: Sri Lanka and Finland to establish political consultation mechanism
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for a proposal to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Sri Lanka and Finland with the objective of establishing a Political Consultation Mechanism to further strengthen bilateral relations.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Sabaragamuwa Province and in Kaluthara, Galle and Matara districts.

title: Govt first and foremost committed to ensuring good governance – President
byline: A special discussion on Sri Lanka’s Third Mutual Evaluation in relation to international standards on Anti-Money Laundering and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) was held this morning (03) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Paris prosecutor’s cybercrime unit searches X office, Musk summoned
byline: French police raided the offices of Elon Musk’s social media network X and prosecutors ordered the tech billionaire to face questions in April related to a widening investigation into the platform, the Paris prosecutor’s office said on Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka records highest-ever tourist arrivals in January 2026
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has reported that a total of 277,327 tourists arrived in Sri Lanka in January 2026.

title: Cabinet nod to award long-term contract to Singaporean firm for procurement of Petrol 92
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the award of a contract to M/s Epdesa Pte. Ltd of Singapore for the supply of Petrol 92 Unleaded (Unl) to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC).

title: Speaker endorses certificate on Universities (Amendment) Bill
byline: he Speaker of Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, today (03) endorsed the certificate on the Universities (Amendment) Bill.

title: Cabinet approves Renewable Energy Resources Development Plan 2025-2030
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the Renewable Energy Resources Development Plan 2025-2030, with the objectives of fulfilling 70% of the national electricity demand from renewable energy resources by the year 2030 and achieving carbon neutrality by the year 2050, in accordance with the National Policy on Renewable Energy.

title: Iran president confirms talks with US after Trump’s threats
byline: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian confirmed on Tuesday that he had ordered the start of nuclear talks with the United States, after his counterpart Donald Trump threatened “bad things” if no deal is reached.

title: SLPP issues statement on FCID summoning Shiranthi Rajapaksa
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has issued a statement this evening (03) regarding the summoning of former First Lady Shiranthi Rajapaksa, the wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, to the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID).

title: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister meets South Korean parliamentary delegation
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath today (03) met with a visiting parliamentary delegation from the National Assembly of the Republic of Korea, led by Deputy Speaker Lee Hack Young.

title: BTS comeback show and documentary to be on Netflix
byline: K-Pop superband BTS have announced a Netflix stream of their first performance since their comeback.

title: 6.0-magnitude earthquake hits Myanmar, tremors felt in parts of India
byline: A magnitude 6 earthquake struck Myanmar on Tuesday, the German Research Center for Geosciences (GFZ) said.

title: Sacred Relics exposition: Special train services for devotees
byline: The Railway Department has arranged several special train services to facilitate devotees travelling to Colombo for the exposition of the sacred bodily relics of Buddha brought from India, which is scheduled to take place from February 05 to 11, 2026 at the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple.
